refnamediv.refpurpose: An action which can be triggered by a menu or toolbar item

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Actions represent operations that the user can be perform, along with some information how it should be presented in the interface. Each action provides methods to create icons, menu items and toolbar items representing itself.

As well as the callback that is called when the action gets activated, the following also gets associated with the action:
a name (not translated, for path lookup)
a label (translated, for display)
an accelerator
whether label indicates a stock id
a tooltip (optional, translated)
a toolbar label (optional, shorter than label)
The action will also have some state information:
visible (shown/hidden)
sensitive (enabled/disabled)

Apart from regular actions, there are toggle actions, which can be toggled between two states and radio actions, of which only one in a group can be in the "active" state. Other actions can be implemented as GtkAction subclasses.

Each action can have one or more proxy menu item, toolbar button or other proxy widgets. Proxies mirror the state of the action (text label, tooltip, icon, visible, sensitive, etc), and should change when the action's state changes. When the proxy is activated, it should activate its action.

refsect2.title: GtkAction
refsect2.para: The GtkAction struct contains only private members and should not be accessed directly.

refsect2.title: gtk_action_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkAction * gtk_action_new (const gchar *name, const gchar *label, const gchar *tooltip, const gchar *stock_id);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkAction object. To add the action to a GtkActionGroup and set the accelerator for the action, call gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel(). See for information on allowed action names.

listitem.simpara: A unique name for the action
the label displayed in menu items and on buttons, or NULL
a tooltip for the action, or NULL
the stock icon to display in widgets representing the action, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Returns the name of the action.

listitem.simpara: the name of the action. The string belongs to GTK+ and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_is_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action is effectively sensitive.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action and its associated action group are both sensitive.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action itself is sensitive. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective sensitivity. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action itself is sensitive.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_set_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Sets the ::sensitive property of the action to sensitive. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective sensitivity. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to make the action sensitive

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_action_is_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action is effectively visible.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action and its associated action group are both visible.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the action itself is visible. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective visibility. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the action itself is visible.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_set_visible ()
refsect2.para: Sets the ::visible property of the action to visible. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective visibility. See gtk_action_is_visible() for that.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to make the action visible

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_action_activate ()
refsect2.para: Emits the "activate" signal on the specified action, if it isn't insensitive. This gets called by the proxy widgets when they get activated.
It can also be used to manually activate an action.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_icon ()
refsect2.para: This function is intended for use by action implementations to create icons displayed in the proxy widgets.

listitem.simpara: the size of the icon that should be created.
a widget that displays the icon for this action.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_menu_item ()
refsect2.para: Creates a menu item widget that proxies for the given action.

listitem.simpara: a menu item connected to the action.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_tool_item ()
refsect2.para: Creates a toolbar item widget that proxies for the given action.

listitem.simpara: a toolbar item connected to the action.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_create_menu ()
refsect2.para: If action provides a GtkMenu widget as a submenu for the menu item or the toolbar item it creates, this function returns an instance of that menu.

listitem.simpara: the menu item provided by the action, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_action_connect_proxy ()

warning.para: gtk_action_connect_proxy has been deprecated since version 2.16 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_activatable_set_related_action() instead.

refsect2.para: Connects a widget to an action object as a proxy. Synchronises various properties of the action with the widget (such as label text, icon, tooltip, etc), and attaches a callback so that the action gets activated when the proxy widget does.
If the widget is already connected to an action, it is disconnected first.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_disconnect_proxy ()

warning.para: gtk_action_disconnect_proxy has been deprecated since version 2.16 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_activatable_set_related_action() instead.

refsect2.para: Disconnects a proxy widget from an action. Does not destroy the widget, however.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_proxies ()
refsect2.para: Returns the proxy widgets for an action. See also gtk_widget_get_action().

listitem.simpara: a GSList of proxy widgets. The list is owned by GTK+ and must not be modified.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_connect_accelerator ()
refsect2.para: Installs the accelerator for action if action has an accel path and group. See gtk_action_set_accel_path() and gtk_action_set_accel_group()

Since multiple proxies may independently trigger the installation of the accelerator, the action counts the number of times this function has been called and doesn't remove the accelerator until gtk_action_disconnect_accelerator() has been called as many times.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_disconnect_accelerator ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the effect of one call to gtk_action_connect_accelerator().
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_block_activate ()
refsect2.para: Disable activation signals from the action

This is needed when updating the state of your proxy GtkActivatable widget could result in calling gtk_action_activate(), this is a convenience function to avoid recursing in those cases (updating toggle state for instance).
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_action_unblock_activate ()
refsect2.para: Reenable activation signals from the action
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_action_block_activate_from ()

warning.para: gtk_action_block_activate_from has been deprecated since version 2.16 and should not be used in newly-written code. activatables are now responsible for activating the action directly so this doesnt apply anymore.

refsect2.para: Disables calls to the gtk_action_activate() function by signals on the given proxy widget. This is used to break notification loops for things like check or radio actions.
This function is intended for use by action implementations.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_unblock_activate_from ()

warning.para: gtk_action_unblock_activate_from has been deprecated since version 2.16 and should not be used in newly-written code. activatables are now responsible for activating the action directly so this doesnt apply anymore.

refsect2.para: Re-enables calls to the gtk_action_activate() function by signals on the given proxy widget. This undoes the blocking done by gtk_action_block_activate_from().
This function is intended for use by action implementations.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_accel_path ()
refsect2.para: Returns the accel path for this action.

listitem.simpara: the accel path for this action, or NULL if none is set. The returned string is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed or modified.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_action_set_accel_path ()
refsect2.para: Sets the accel path for this action. All proxy widgets associated with the action will have this accel path, so that their accelerators are consistent.
Note that accel_path string will be stored in a GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_action_get_accel_closure ()
refsect2.para: Returns the accel closure for this action.

listitem.simpara: the accel closure for this action. The returned closure is owned by GTK+ and must not be unreffed or modified.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8

refsect2.title: gtk_action_set_accel_group ()
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkAccelGroup in which the accelerator for this action will be installed.

refsect2.title: The "action-group" property
refsect2.para: The GtkActionGroup this GtkAction is associated with, or NULL (for internal use).

refsect2.title: The "gicon" property
refsect2.para: The GIcon displayed in the GtkAction.
Note that the stock icon is preferred, if the "stock-id" property holds the id of an existing stock icon.
This is an appearance property and thus only applies if "use-action-appearance" is TRUE.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "hide-if-empty" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, empty menu proxies for this action are hidden.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "icon-name" property
refsect2.para: The name of the icon from the icon theme.
Note that the stock icon is preferred, if the "stock-id" property holds the id of an existing stock icon, and the GIcon is preferred if the "gicon" property is set.
This is an appearance property and thus only applies if "use-action-appearance" is TRUE.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "is-important" property
refsect2.para: Whether the action is considered important. When TRUE, toolitem proxies for this action show text in GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ mode.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "label" property
refsect2.para: The label used for menu items and buttons that activate this action. If the label is NULL, GTK+ uses the stock label specified via the stock-id property.
This is an appearance property and thus only applies if "use-action-appearance" is TRUE.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "name" property
refsect2.para: A unique name for the action.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "sensitive" property
refsect2.para: Whether the action is enabled.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "short-label" property
refsect2.para: A shorter label that may be used on toolbar buttons.
This is an appearance property and thus only applies if "use-action-appearance" is TRUE.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "stock-id" property
refsect2.para: The stock icon displayed in widgets representing this action.
This is an appearance property and thus only applies if "use-action-appearance" is TRUE.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "tooltip" property
refsect2.para: A tooltip for this action.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "visible" property
refsect2.para: Whether the action is visible.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "visible-horizontal" property
refsect2.para: Whether the toolbar item is visible when the toolbar is in a horizontal orientation.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "visible-overflown" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, toolitem proxies for this action are represented in the toolbar overflow menu.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "visible-vertical" property
refsect2.para: Whether the toolbar item is visible when the toolbar is in a vertical orientation.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "activate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAction *action, gpointer user_data) : Run First / No Recursion
refsect2.para: The "activate" signal is emitted when the action is activated.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4
